page.title: 02The Ashton Memorial (C)
page.content: The limestone memorial with a copper dome was built in 1908 by Lord Ashton formerly James Williamson,owner of a factory which made linoleum that was invented by his father.He was for a time MP for Lancaster.It was built in memory of his wife at a cost of 87000 pounds.It is situated in Williamson Park so it dominates the sky-line of Lancaster.Over the years it fell into disrepair and in 1984 the City Council voted to put 100000 pounds towards the fund for restoring the memorial. In October 1981 it was estimated it would cost 368742 pounds to turn the ground floor into a craft centre and the first floor into an exhibition centre.The present plan is to use the building as the focal point of a Theme Park.From special platforms people will be able to look out on the town and park.
